intro: Cnicus deltoideus, commonly known as the deltoid groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a low-growing habit with a spreading base, and its leaves are often covered in fine hairs. Cnicus deltoideus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
